page.title: 11Newport Conservation Area
page.content: This{Ecology}project was started in January 1984 and is named after the area in which it's found, Norbroom Marsh.It was set up to make a safe living place for{wildlife,}and, plant life.Already there are about 300 trees.Most of these trees were given by local schools,Councils and the public.The work was carried out by voleutees.Some of the money was donated by the Wrekcin District Council,and the Newport Council.All of the trees and paths cost about Â£415.Miss Mc'Clean is the founder member and is in charge of the project.The area was a rubbish tip since 1665 till the late 1970's, Norbroom Marsh has some rare birds and one of them is the redshank.This is rare because it normally nests on rocky cliffs at the seaside.
